snippet: Maureen O’Connor blamed an addiction aggravated by a brain tumor for a gargantuan spree that she financed in part by taking from her husband’s charity.
abstract: Maureen O'Connor, former mayor of San Diego, spent the last decade wagering more than $1 billion at casinos, losing her fortune and taking more than $2 million from charity set up by her late husband and fast-food tycoon Robert O Peterson; she blames her spree on a gambling addiction aggravated by a brain tumor.

byline.contributor: Ian Lovett contributed reporting from Los Angeles, and Will Carless from San Diego.

lead_paragraph: Maureen O’Connor blamed an addiction aggravated by a brain tumor for a gargantuan spree that she financed in part by taking from her husband’s charity.

headline.seo: Over a Decade, Maureen O’Connor Spent $1 Billion on Bets
headline.main: San Diego Ex-Mayor Confronts $1 Billion Gambling Problem
